item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.11.0.24
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.11.0.24
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Mon, 13 Jul 2020 18:35:45 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462). This version is configured to handle multiple cards (up to 16) for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO. You can configure a number of analog outputs (up to 32) to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with DC offsets. Each of the analog inputs (up to 32) can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.11.0.24]
- Update the way the user choosing the sampling frequency (Fs) and number of samples (N) (issues #7 #26)
- Manual: user's choice
- Auto: Fs = N*F1
- max Fs: Fs = maximum, decimation = 100, LP filter = Fs/100/4, N = Fs/refresh rate
- Fix issues where incorrect results would be given if more than one demodulation frequency is choses (issue #27)
- New AI simulation modes:
- HW simulation configured by MAX
- AI = noise*AO
- AI = simulate electron waveguide (https://github.com/levylabpitt/Multichannel-Lockin#simulation-mode)
- AO1 = source voltage
- AO2 = gate voltage
- AI1 = drain current
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Graph Utilities v2.1.0.1
item.description:
Product: Graph Utilities v2.1.0.1
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 08 Jul 2020 16:29:44 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Misc. graph utilities

Release Notes: [2.1.0.1]
New Feature!
- <b>Intensity Graph Histogram Control.vi</b>: easily set the z scale of your intensity graph based on where most of the data is

New Methods
- <b>Set XY Graph X/Y Range.vi</b>: set min/max of the X/Y scale
- <b>Set Intensity Graph X/Y Scale [Array] OR [Min and Max].vi</b>: You can set the axis scaling (offset and multiplier) using either an [Array] or [Min and Max] values
- <b>Set Intensity Graph X/Y/Z Range.vi</b>: set min/max of the X/Y/Z scales
- <b>Get * Reference.vi</b>: Accessors to read graph references

Removed:
- <b>Set Intensity Graph Scales (Start and End).vi</b>
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Asylum AFM API v1.0.0.2
item.description:
Product: Asylum AFM API v1.0.0.2
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Mon, 06 Jul 2020 09:54:23 -0400
Packager: Joseph Albro

Description: This is a LabVIEW wrapper meant to facilitate the use of the text based Asylum Instruments ActiveX API. These are the lowest level commands. Please note that these commands may be out of date. This package will need to be updated as time goes on and new functionality is needed.

Release Notes: Added a way to set a debug mode that wont send commands to the instrument, but rather would open up the Debug window.

item.title: Transport v1.4.0.16
item.description:
Product: Transport v1.4.0.16
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Wed, 01 Jul 2020 13:47:23 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
Control Experiment.vi provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device, how the lockin is connected to the device, configures the Krohn Hite amplifier (and Pickering switch if you have one), and sets the base path for saving data.

[SweepControl.lvclass]
Sweep Control.vi: Sequencer for stepping multiple parameters. Calls VIs in Transport.lvclass
Continuous B sweep.vi: For sweeping B continuously while asynchronously calling VIs in Transport.lvclass

[Transport.lvclass]
Basic transport measurments.
- Lockin vs Vsg (or Vbg) (Lockin_Vsg.vi)
- Lockin vs Time (Lockin_time.vi)
- Lockin Sweep Mode (Lockin_sweep.vi (under development)
- IV curves (IV.vi)

Release Notes: [1.4.0.16]
- Issue #2: Open Me.vi shortcuts to transport VIs
- Issue #3: Fix KH channel initialization issue
- Issue #9: Move YAML code to YAML/PLYM package
- Issue #10: Improve the way AI and KH channels are updated on front panel
- New build using LabVIEW 2020
- Updated package dependencies
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.10.1.23
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Tue, 30 Jun 2020 20:31:18 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462). This version is configured to handle multiple cards (up to 16) for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO. You can configure a number of analog outputs (up to 32) to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with DC offsets. Each of the analog inputs (up to 32) can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.10.1.23]
- Issue #21: fix lockin channel ring control
- Issue #24: fix issues with setting multiple reference frequencies
- Change handling of mouse events inside cluster controls
- Change AI graph labels
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.10.0.22
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.10.0.22
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 26 Jun 2020 15:26:52 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462). This version is configured to handle multiple cards (up to 16) for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO. You can configure a number of analog outputs (up to 32) to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with DC offsets. Each of the analog inputs (up to 32) can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.10.0.22]
- update AO/AI DAQ loops to parallel loops with 16 instances, allowing dynamic scaling to maximum 16 DAQ cards (32 synchronized AO/AI when using 4461 cards)
- new APIs:
- setAIDAQ: configure AI DAQ hardware
- setAODAQ: configure AO DAQ hardware
- getRefreshTime: get the lockin refresh time
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
